channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Donald Trump trumpets bizarre conspiracy theory about 75-year-old man Buffalo cops pushed to ground
item.description: President Donald Trump tweeted out a conspiracy theory Tuesday about the man who was knocked down by Buffalo police at a protester, claiming the man could be an 'ANTIFA porvocateur.'

item.title: Madeleine McCann: Suspect applies for early prison release
item.description: Christian Brueckner, 43, has served two thirds of his 15-month drug dealing sentence in jail in Kiel, northern Germany, and is believed to have lodged papers seeking release last Friday.

item.title: Thomas Lane's lawyer blames George Floyd for staying in car
item.description: Thomas Lane's attorney Earl Gray told Chris Cuomo on Cuomo Prime Time Monday night that Floyd shouldn't have resisted arrest and should have followed the cops' orders.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Alok Sharma says shops to reopen on 15 June
item.description: The move will provide a lifeline for businesses and workers who have taken a battering from the effects of coronavirus and provide a relief for weary consumers who have been stuck at home for months.

item.title: George Floyd will be buried today in Houston next to his mother
item.description: George Floyd, the black man whose brutal death at the hands of police has sparked a worldwide reckoning over racial injustice, will be laid to rest in his hometown of Houston today.

item.title: Cop in Breonna Taylor raid faces sexual assault accusations
item.description: Officer Brett Hankison, left, has been accused by two women of assaulting them. Taylor, right, a black emergency medical tech, was shot by police in Louisville, Kentucky on March 13.

item.title: The striking winning images from the 2020 Sony World Photography Awards
item.description: This year, the competition received 346,000 entries from photographers all around the world in 10 categories including architecture, environment and landscape.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Continued DROP in driving and walking
item.description: Springboard footfall data showed an 11 per cent fall in people going out to shop yesterday compared to the previous week, with numbers also down for every day back to and including June 3.

item.title: Stranded cat tries to resist RNLI rescue from rising river tide
item.description: A distressed black cat did not make life easy for a Chiswick RNLI crewman trying to save it from a submerging river bank on the River Thames as it hissed and snarled at him and tried to run away.

item.title: Crowds of Black Lives Matter demonstrators gather in London for George Floyd's funeral
item.description: The family of Mr Floyd are preparing to lay his body to rest in his home town of Houston, following weeks of protests over his death.

item.title: 'Georgia state trooper declines Black Lives Matter protesters' demands that he take a knee
item.description: Video footage has emerged of O'Neal Saddler, who cancelled his plans to help keep protesters safe, at the Black Lives Matter rally in Hartwell in Georgia.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Anti-coronavirus shield made for plane seats
item.description: A UK-based aircraft interior company has designed what it claims is an 'industry-first' anti-coronavirus personal protection window that can shield passengers from droplet transmission.

item.title: Sea captain and ex-wife locked in bitter divorce fight over £10million fleet of ships
item.description: Caroline Crowther, 49, claimed at London's Appeal Court that her sea captain husband Paul has given ownership of a £10m fleet of ships to a business associate to avoid losing them in a divorce battle.

item.title: Gatwick will reopen its north terminal next Monday
item.description: Gatwick Airport in West Sussex has only been operating its south terminal since April 1 and airlines have faced a collapse in demand during the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: French singer who was accused of sending sexual messages to teens jokes about girlfriend age gap
item.description: Speaking on French television, Jean Luc Lahaye, 67, introduced his girlfriend Paula Winckler - believed to be in her 20s - and made light of the age gap, saying men 'always want' younger women.

item.title: When will Duke and Duchess of Cambridge resume public duties?
item.description: Despite plans for a further easing of lockdown in the UK next week, FEMAIL understands there is currently no set plan in place for the British royal family to step out publicly any time soon.

item.title: BLM: Sadiq Khan calls for removal of slave trader statues
item.description: The demonstration has been organised by the Rhodes Must Fall Oxford campaign group and comes after activists identified 60 UK statues they want removed.

item.title: Planets with DUSTY atmospheres are more likely to harbour alien life
item.description: This discovery by researchers from the University of Exeter dramatically extends the number of planets able to host life - and expands the possible habitable zone.

item.title: Coronavirus: EU accuses China and Russia of misinformation push
item.description: A 17-page EU report into Chinese and Russian coronavirus misinformation campaigns says Beijing and Moscow had set out to polarise debate and burnish their own images.

item.title: Banksy suggests replacement for Edward Colston statue
item.description: The artist unveiled a new piece of artwork inspired by activists who pulled down a bronze statue of the 17th-century slave trader and threw it in Bristol's harbour.

item.title: Racists or heroes? Black Lives Matter want to topple statues of famous Britons due to slavery links
item.description: Black Lives Matter activists are calling for the removal of 60 statues of slave owners and racists across Britain. On a website called Topple The Racists, members can propose statues to fall.

item.title: Discarded plastic bottles make up a QUARTER of the UK's litter
item.description: Plastic bottles are UK's most commonly littered item accounting for a quarter of all rubbish discarded on streets, parks and beaches, a new study reveals.

item.title: Heavy former police dog rescued after getting stuck in bench
item.description: A former police dog carrying too much weight had to be rescued by a group of half a dozen people after getting himself stuck in a park bench in this hilarious clip.

item.title: Coronavirus: Asymptomatic people ARE spreading disease
item.description: Harvard's Global Health institute says the WHO 'created confusion' with its statement on Monday during a news briefing that those without symptoms are readily spreading the virus.

item.title: Hilarious video shows ice-cream-eating cat with 'brain freeze'
item.description: This is the hilarious moment a cat gets its first taste of ice cream and instantly regrets it. The video, posted by a Canadian TikTok user on June 3, shows the cat being fed the frozen treat.

item.title: Yorkshire Tea hits back at far-right YouTuber over anti-Black Lives Matter tweet
item.description: Laura Towler, described as an influential far-right vlogger, received a stern response from the British tea brand after she told them she was 'chuffed' they hadn't posted on Black Lives Matter.

item.title: Nigel Farage blasted for 'inciting racism' after comparing Black Lives Matter group to the Taliban
item.description: Brexit Party leader Nigel Farage accused the Black Lives Matter protesters of 'unpicking history' and compared them to terrorist organisation The Taliban during a row on Good Morning Britain.

item.title: Tesla supplier's battery lasts 16 years and a MILLION miles
item.description: Contemporary Amperex Technology, which builds Tesla's batteries, revealed it is ready to produce a rechargeable battery that lasts for 16 years or 1.24 million miles before it would need to be replaced.

item.title: Natalie Portman explains how she initially 'feared' #DeFundThePolice but now she supports it
item.description: Natalie Portman revealed she first feared the #DeFundThePolice movement, but after educating herself more, she now supports it.

item.title: NHS chief tells staff health service is 'part of problem' in letter on Black Lives Matter protests
item.description: NHS chief executive Simon Stevens said the Black Lives Matter protests and the coronavirus pandemic 'are not disconnected', in a letter shared with NHS England staff yesterday.

item.title: Rolling out a vaccine too quickly could be dangerous Imperial's lead scientist says
item.description: Professor Robin Shattock - heading up trials of Imperial College London's Covid-19 jab - admitted it could be 'dangerous' to give doses while the puzzle of immunity remains unsolved.
item.media:description: Tests on a possible vaccine are well under way (PA)

item.title: 'Independent SAGE' group says UK's Test and Trace scheme is 'not fit for purpose'
item.description: The group of experts, led by the former Government chief scientific adviser Sir David King, have said the virus will only be contained if 80 per cent of the contacts of infected people are traced and contacted.

item.title: Allied troops grind down Nazi war machine in colourised photos
item.description: Images taken during the final year of fighting in Europe during the Second World War captures how the Allies reduced the Nazi war machine from a fierce fighting force to units of old men and children.

item.title: Study does NOT recommend probiotics for Crohn's disease
item.description: New guidelines released by the American Gastroenterological Association identified only three clinical scenarios where probiotic use might benefit patients.

item.title: Priti Patel reads riot act to police chief who ALLOWED protesters to tear down statue
item.description: Mark Shelford, a Police and Crime Commissioner Candidate for Avon and Somerset, says police had 'two opportunities to intervene' when protesters ripped down a statue of Edward Colston in Bristol.

item.title: Heavily-pregnant woman stabbed and hanged in South Africa
item.description: Pregnant Tshegofatso Pule, 28, went missing last week in Johannesburg after arguing with her boyfriend, and her body was found on Monday - hanged from a tree with a stab wound to her chest.

item.title: Gavin Williamson DROPS plans to bring back all primary school children before Summer
item.description: Gavin Williamson today announced the Government has scrapped its target of getting all primary school pupils back in the classroom before the summer holidays.

item.title: Missguided uses size 8 model to advertise plus-size range
item.description: Eagle-eyed shoppers spotted a disclaimer on the UK fast-fashion website Missguided, admitting that the models used for the brand's plus-size collection are from its 'Mainline' range.

item.title: Chinese scooter rider puts metal bowl 'helmet' on dog's head
item.description: Viral footage released by local media shows the pooch fastened with ropes while sitting in a plastic basket on the moving moped in the Chinese eastern city Hangzhou, Zhejiang province.

item.title: Tony Blair calls for new 'digital ID' so people can prove their coronavirus 'disease status'
item.description: The former Prime Minister said that only if people can show easily whether they are clear of coronavirus will industries like international travel be able to restart.

item.title: Chinese firefighter saves girl, 5, from balcony at 130 feet
item.description: The five-year-old Chinese child was standing on a tiny ledge and clinging onto the window frame of her 13th floor home when firefighters arrived at the scene in the Chinese city of Kunming today.

item.title: Brad Pitt joins George Floyd protesters in Hollywood
item.description: Brad Pitt was spotted attending a major protest over the death of George Floyd in Hollywood on Sunday afternoon.

item.title: Little Britain removed from Netflix, BBC iPlayer and BritBox
item.description: Little Britain has been removed from Netflix, BBC iPlayer and BritBox amid concerns that the use of blackface characters on the series is no longer acceptable.

item.title: Princess Alice tried to save Russian princesses from murder
item.description: Prince Philip's cousin revealed Princess Alice tried to save Princesses Olga, Maria,Tatiana and Anastasia Nikolaevna before they were murdered during the Russian revolution.

item.title: Iceland supermarket adopts Chester Zoo's penguins to fundraise
item.description: Supermarket giants Iceland have adopted a whole rookery of Humboldt penguins in a bid to support Chester Zoo as the popular attraction faces an uncertain future amid coronavirus.

item.title: Remdesivir may prevent lung damage in coronavirus patients, monkey study suggests
item.description: Gilead Sciences's antiviral drug, remdesivir, prevented lung disease in macaque monkeys infected with the new coronavirus, an NIH study found. The researchers urge giving the drug early.

item.title: Instagram slammed as 'racist' after marking video of group of black men dancing t as 'sensitive'
item.description: British campaign group, 56 Black Men, which fights against negative racial stereotypes, shared a video to their Instagram page showing protesters dancing at a Black Lives Matter march.

item.title: 'Priceless' Mayan wall paintings found in Guatemala blend indigenous techniques with Spanish motifs
item.description: The artworks - thought to date back to around 1524-1821 AD - were first uncovered in 2003 during renovations of the property, which lies in the town of Chajul.

item.title: Ship delivering yachts worth millions of pounds overturns and narrowly avoids completely capsizing
item.description: The merchant ship Super Servant 4 overturned when it arrived at the Palma de Majorca port after sailing for around two weeks from Port Everglades in Fort Lauderdale, Florida .

item.title: Could UK Wealth Tax lessen economic impact of coronavirus?
item.description: Some have pointed to countries such as Norway as an example of how a wealth tax can work, but often country-by-country comparisons can oversimplify matters.

item.title: Ellis Genge left furious after BBC use picture of England team-mate Lewis Ludlam instead
item.description: Genge, who plays for Leicester Tigers and has won 18 caps for England, furiously tweeted his disgust, posting: 'I'm actually f***ed off with this happening to every mixed race/black sportsperson.'

item.title: Labour leader Keir Starmer 'takes a knee' in solidarity with Black Lives Matter protesters
item.description: Opposition leader shared a picture on social media of him kneeling alongside his deputy Angela Rayner this afternoon, saying: 'We kneel with all those opposing anti-Black racism.'

item.title: Coronavirus Iran: 15m may have been infected, official admits
item.description: Fifteen million Iranians may have been infected with coronavirus since Iran's outbreak started in February, one of the country's top health officials admitted today.

item.title: Statue of Belgium's King Leopold II is removed in Antwerp
item.description: Leopold owned the Belgian Congo as his personal property from 1885 to 1908 and subjected its people to forced labour while he exploited the country's rubber reserves - leading to millions of deaths.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: SAGE experts question Test and Trace scheme
item.description: Susan Michie, professor of health psychology at University College London and a member of SAGE, said isolating cases was the most vital part of the system and leaving it out of the title was 'puzzling'.

item.title: Kickboxer, 22, will deny murdering Real Housewives of Cheshire star's brother
item.description: Flamur Beqiri, who was the brother of former Real Housewives Of Cheshire star Misse Beqiri (both pictured), was shot multiple times in Battersea, south-west London.

item.title: Mother jailed for two years after son, 9, mauled to death by dog
item.description: Truro Crown Court heard the boy had been left alone at a caravan in the Tencreek Holiday Park in Looe, Cornwall, with the dog named Winston, who had previously bitten another child.

item.title: Britain's Covid-19 deaths rise by 286 in preliminary count
item.description: It means the official number of Covid-19 fatalities now stands at 40,883. But separate grim statistics released today suggested the disease has already claimed at least 51,000 lives in the UK.

item.title: Crown courts face backlog of 41,000 trials due to lockdown
item.description: Lord Chancellor Robert Buckland (pictured) admitted that the Government faces a 'challenge' to manage the growing caseload as it was revealed 168 courts have reopened as of June 3.

item.title: Coronavirus: Smartphone screens should be cleaned regularly
item.description: Professor Rajneesh Bhardwaj from the Indian Institute of Technology in Bombay lead the research and found cotton and wood are also materials that can provide a safe haven for the virus.

item.title: Critics slam 'sexist' government policy closing public toilets
item.description: Speaking to FEMAIL, British charity campaigners and medical experts warned the measure 'adversely and disproportionately affects women and girls'.

item.title: Health Minister blames scientists for care home deaths before backtracking
item.description: A Health Minister today sparked a row over the Government's approach to protecting care homes from coronavirus as she suggested scientists could be blamed for deaths before backtracking.

item.title: Barclays Bank removes name of slave-owning tobacco lord Andrew Buchanan from new HQ in Glasgow
item.description: Barclays have removed the name 'Buchanan' from its Buchanan Wharf development in Glasgow. It comes after a petition against the name of the site, which will house its HQ and 300 homes.

item.title: Holidaymakers get Covid refunds on Welcome Cottages and Hoseasons
item.description: The Competition and Markets Authority said its taskforce received around 4,500 reports about UK holiday rental companies, with Vacation Rentals issues making up a 'significant proportion'.

item.title: Burundi's President Pierre Nkurunziza dies of heart attack at 55
item.description: Burundi's government announced Nkurunziza's 'unexpected' death with 'great sadness' in a statement today, declaring a national week of mourning.

item.title: Police officer admits stopping man 'because he is black' in video
item.description: Cambridgeshire Police are investigating an officer who was recorded stopping a motorist in Ely in 2015 because 'black males from outside the area deal drugs'.

item.title: Murder in the Outback viewers slam Joanne Lees as 'emotionless'
item.description: Murder in the Outback: The Falconio and Lees Mystery looks back at the case after Peter went missing on a Northern Territory roadside in 2001, while on holiday with his girlfriend Joanne.

item.title: Mysterious repetitive radio bursts reported from deep space
item.description: Researchers from the University of Manchester studied long-term monitoring data from the Lovell Telescope at Jodrell Bank to understand these unusual signals.

item.title: Australian nocturnal parrot 'has not evolved to see in the dark'
item.description: The rare parrot was presumed extinct for more than a century until the corpse of one that had been hit by a truck was found by an Australian roadside in 1990.

item.title: Trisha Goddard reveals she accepted a tearful apology from Leigh Francis
item.description: The Channel 4 series, which aired between 2002 and 2006, featured Francis portraying a series of celebrities; including Michael Jackson, Craig David and Trisha

item.title: Rich get RICHER in lockdown: Nearly 2m UK households are set to emerge from restrictions better off
item.description: Research shows that 57 per cent of the richest fifth of UK families have managed to cut their spending but poorer households have been forced to borrow money.

item.title: Woman left with protruding implant after botched nose surgery
item.description: The lump had slipped from her nose bridge to her nose tip before poking out through the skin, the devastated woman said. She had to walk around with the eyesore for days before having it removed.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Government 'set to DROP 14-day quarantine'
item.description: Travel company bosses in Britain say they have been assured UK plans will be altered within weeks But Madrid today said it was only speaking to other EU states about a bloc-wide agreement.

item.title: Georgian men lusted after middle-aged women who were valued as experienced
item.description: University of Cambridge researcher, Ella Sbaraini, looked at Georgian diaries, prints, pamphlets and other records to paint a picture of female sexuality in middle-age.

item.title: Coronavirus France: 'Involuntary homicide' charges considered
item.description: Remy Heitz will use the investigation to consider whether 'possible criminal offences' were committed, following a wave of complaints filed by civil groups and members of the public.

item.title: Twin, 21, who took ecstasy for the first time was found dead on her bathroom floor, inquest hears
item.description: Kirstie Smith's body was found on May 5 2019 in the bathroom of her Wolverhampton house shared with her boyfriend - she had taken a 'significant' amount of MDMA for the first time.

item.title: China plans colossal £59million panda theme park nearly 30 times the size of Hong Kong Disneyland
item.description: The panda theme park in Chengdu will occupy 13.8 square miles (35.7 square kilometres), according to a government plan. It is set to comprise a panda breeding base, hotels and exhibition centres.
item.media:credit: China News Service via Getty Ima

item.title: Unemployment could taken SEVEN YEARS to fall back to pre-coronavirus levels according to experts
item.description: Leading economists told the Treasury Committee they predict 'really high unemployment for the foreseeable future' as a result of the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: McDonald's to reopen 11 'walk-in' restaurants next week
item.description: McDonald's has today announced a new 'walk in' service from next week which will allow customers across the UK to collect orders at the till.

item.title: Injecting coronavirus patients with the blood of virus survivors DOES speed up their recovery
item.description: Scientists in Sweden and Finland, behind the new study, said global research indicates convalescent immune plasma 'is well tolerated and effective'. They reviewed 10 global studies of the therapy.

item.title: Miss Hitler beauty pageant contestant who called herself 'The Buchenwald Princess' is jailed
item.description: Alice Cutter, 23, was found guilty of belonging to the terrorist group alongside her former partner Mark Jones following a trial at Birmingham Crown Court in March.

item.title: 'Conspiracy theorists' hide RAZOR blades and NEEDLES behind anti-5G posters
item.description: East Sussex Highways issued the stark warning urging anyone who sees the banners not to touch them and to report it to the police (file image of a 5G mast).

item.title: Coronavirus UK: 'Whole flights' of passengers land without filling in quarantine form
item.description: Travellers told of three-hour wait times at Manchester Airport, some said the QR codes they were asked to scan did not work and others claimed they were faced with 'snotty' border guards.

item.title: Kate Middleton has 'an enquiring mind' and is 'clearly compassionate'
item.description: Broadcaster Kate Silverton praised the Duchess of Cambridge, 38, for her work in children's development, calling her 'really impressive' in an interview with Hello magazine.

item.title: Meghan Markle delivered 'pretty raw' speech 'without notes', source tells Newsweek
item.description: Meghan Markle's, 38, speech to her former school about Black Lives Matter and George Floyd's death was delivered 'without notes' and was 'pretty raw', insiders told Newsweek.

item.title: Police investigating Madeleine McCann suspect Christian Brueckner hunt for his ex-girlfriend
item.description: Prime suspect Christian Brueckner is in a German jail for drug trafficking while appealing a seven-year sentence for a rape in Praia da Luz months before Madeleine was abducted 13 years ago.

item.title: Sky News apologises after Prince Andrew video blunder
item.description: Presenter Dermot Murnaghan apologised after video of Prince Andrew was aired during story about the Madeleine McCann prime suspect, a German paedophile.

item.title: Novichok victim Dawn Sturgess' flat in Salisbury is to be torn down two years after her death
item.description: Mother-of-three Ms Sturgess and her partner Charlie Rowley fell ill at the flat in Amesbury, near Salisbury in Wiltshire, after she handled a perfume bottle containing the lethal poison.

item.title: Tom Daley was 'shocked' by negativity surrounding birth of son
item.description: Tom Daley, 26, is currently at his central London flat with his screenwriter husband Dustin Lance Black, 45, and their toddler son Robbie, along with Tom's mother, amid the ongoing pandemic.

item.title: How to prevent laptop screen reflection when working outside
item.description: Sarah Roberts, an insurance worker from Norwich, took to Facebook to reveal the very simple trick to dodging the pesky reflection from the sun on your laptop screen.

item.title: Manager is awarded £36,000 payout after his job was deemed too boring
item.description: Parisian Frédéric Desnard, who worked as a manager at Interparfum for four years, originally sued the perfume company for £550,000 because his job there was so boring that it drove him to depression.

item.title: Aspiring model prison worker jailed after inventing claim she was raped by Asian taxi driver
item.description: The lies of Victoria Hoynes, who worked with sex offenders in Durham and entered north-east beauty pageants, resulted in two drivers having their reputations and work prospects damaged.

item.title: Aspiring model prison worker jailed after inventing claim she was raped by Asian taxi driver
item.description: The lies of Victoria Hoynes, who worked with sex offenders in Durham and entered north-east beauty pageants, resulted in two drivers having their reputations and work prospects damaged.

item.title: Human bone growth depends on estrogen, study claims
item.description: Men have evolved to be taller than women because estrogen, the primary female sex hormone, governs bone growth peaks earlier in females, a new study claims.

item.title: Woman saw bodies of murdered sisters before police found them
item.description: Sisters Bibaa Henry, 46, and Nicole Smallman, 27, were discovered by police on Sunday lunchtime at Fryent Country Park in Wembley, north west London.

item.title: Tinder couple became 'official' via Zoom during lockdown
item.description: Sarah Greatrex and Tom Edwards, both 29, matched on Tinder and went on eight dates before the UK went into lockdown on March 23, reports the BBC.

item.title: PizzaExpress reopens click-and-collect at 13 London restaurants
item.description: The popular pizza chain, which started in Soho in 1965, is opening restaurants for a collection service in north, south and west London as part of a phased return as lockdown eases.

item.title: Giant larvacean could help the battle against climate change
item.description: A mysterious sea creature that lives 1,000ft below the surface encased in a giant bubble of mucus may be key to removing the greenhouse gas from the atmosphere.

item.title: Coronavirus: UK's National Grid coal-free for two MONTHS
item.description: According to the National Grid, the last time a coal-powered generator was online in Britain was at midnight on Thursday April 9.

item.title: Coronavirus Spain: Masks compulsory until cure or vaccine found
item.description: Spain's Health Minister Salvador Illa revealed on Tuesday the drastic measure will remain in place even after the country's state of emergency ends on 21 June.

item.title: Laurence Fox angry as BBC's Nihal Arthanayake shuns his music
item.description: Continuing his bitter war of words with Radio 5 Live DJ Nihal Arthanayake, 49, the actor and singer, 42, criticised the broadcaster for removing his music from his show

item.title: Holiday rep who was raped by stranger in apartment 20 miles from where Maddie disappeared speaks out
item.description: Hazel Behan says a stranger entered her apartment in Praia da Rocha, Portugal, set up a video camera, tied her with ropes and raped her in 2004.

item.title: UK's REAL coronavirus death toll is at least 10,000 too low
item.description: Office for National Statistics data shows 46,421 people died of Covid-19 in England and Wales by May 29. The official figure for the same day was just 35,967.

item.title: Mother-of-two, 46, stabbed boyfriend because he texted her 'Happy birthday' instead of calling
item.description: Janet Kearns, 47, has been jailed for six years after she stabbed boyfriend Alan Pearce, in his 60s, in his Manchester apartment for texting her 'happy birthday' and not calling her.

item.title: Couple from London spend lockdown staying in a luxury TREEHOUSE in Somerset
item.description: Sam Harper, 32, and Rebecca Harper, 31, left their Fulham home just before lockdown and have temporarily moved into the luxury treehouse in East Harptree, Somerset, which belongs to Sam's dad.

item.title: NHS boss sacked after boasting Terry Jones' death buried bad news about dementia patient abuse
item.description: Mark Prentice sent a triumphant note to bosses at the Norfolk and Suffolk Foundation Trust, saying the Monty Python star's death helped bury bad news about the abuse of Doreen Livermore.

item.title: Saturn polar hexagon caused by massive cyclones deep in the atmosphere
item.description: Saturn's polar hexagon is 18,000 miles wide and has been observed for the past 40 years - since it was first discovered by the NASA Voyager mission in 1981.

item.title: Housemistress, 59, sues leading £35,000-a-year boarding school for £1.8million
item.description: Lindsey Shaw, 59, fractured her right wrist at £35,000-a-year Mill Hill School, in north London, in June 2016, when she slipped and fell following a meeting with a pupil and a parent.

item.title: BBC2 documentary lifts lid on Monaco's ultra rich
item.description: New BBC2 series Inside Monaco: Playground Of The Rich saw Prince Albert of Monaco waive strict privacy rules to reveal the luxurious life of the tiny country's super wealthy.

item.title: Sweden's coronavirus plan has 'failed miserably', opposition politicians declare
item.description: Jimmie Akesson, leader of the far-right Sweden Democrats, has called for state epidemiologist Anders Tegnell (pictured) to resign, saying his coronavirus strategy has been a 'miserable failure'.

item.title: Men who proposed and were rejected share their stories
item.description: Reddit user jagaraujo kicked off the thread on Sunday by asking guys to share their proposal rejection stories.

item.title: TV angler Jeremy Wade reveals how he survived a plane crash in the Amazon
item.description: This week TV presenter and angler Jeremy Wade checks in to our travel Q&A. He talks about his first holiday memory, his favourite place for a weekend trip, his best fishing moment and more.

item.title: Iran says it will execute 'CIA spy' who 'helped US kill General Soleimani'
item.description: Iran says Seyed Mahmoud Mousavi Majd - an Iranian national accused of spying for the US - accepted a large amount of money to reveal the location of General Soleimani before he was killed by a drone.

item.title: The fat blue line! TWO THIRDS of Hampshire Police officers are obese or overweight, chief reveals
item.description: Almost 70 per cent of officers in Hampshire Constabulary are considered either overweight or obese, the force's Chief Superintendent Lucy Hutson has warned.

item.title: Racists are caught on camera hurling shocking abuse at Black Lives Matter protestors
item.description: Around 300 Black Lives Matters protestors gathered in Hoddesdon, Hertfordshire yesterday, where they were met by angry 'racists' who hurled shocking abuse at them.

item.title: US prosecutors 'want a face-to-face interview with Prince Andrew'
item.description: Andrew is embroiled in a public spat with US investigators who claim he has failed to co-operate with the Epstein probe - despite Andrew's insistence that he has made three offers to help.

item.title: Amazed driver shows the moment his Tesla automatically swerved to avoid a pig at night
item.description: Pranay Pathole, 22, an IT worker studying in Maharashtra, India said the car automatically veered away from the animal on Sunday when it suddenly appeared in the middle of the road.

item.title: Barclays hits back at high-flying financier Amanda Staveley's legal claim
item.description: Amanda Staveley, who once dated the Duke of York, accuses executives at Barclays of sexism in a bitter dispute over a multi-billion-pound bailout in 2008. Barclays bosses say she paints a 'false' picture.

item.title: Duke and Duchess of York 'sent pizzas' to a charity helping people trapped in sexual exploitation
item.description: The Duke, 61, and Duchess of York, 60, 'recently sent pizzas and meals' to a Christian charity which helps people who have been trafficked or trapped in sexual exploitation.

item.title: Junior doctor, 28, faces jail for possessing extreme images of nine-year-old boy and bestiality
item.description: Dr Mohsan Anwar, of Llandegfan in Anglesey, north Wales, appeared before magistrates yesterday to admit two charges.
item.media:credit: Â© Andrew Price / View Finder Pi

item.title: Couple told they were infertile left in 'total shock' after naturally conceiving identical triplets
item.description: Lina Sapia, 35, of Walton-on-Thames, Surrey, beat the staggering one in 200 million odds by naturally conceiving the babies - after needing IVF to conceive her firstborn Alba, one.

item.title: How DO they stay looking so fresh?
item.description: Speaking to FEMAIL, British skin and beauty experts have broken down six celebrity routines to explain exactly how they stay looking so fresh, even without professional treatments.

item.title: Munroe Bergdorf makes peace with L'Oreal Paris after racism row
item.description: Bergdorf, 32, revealed she'd shared a 'constructive' conversation with L'Oreal Paris' Brand President Delphine Viguier, who expressed 'regret' the model had felt 'silenced' by the company.

item.title: Singing Syrian football fans perch high up on rooftops to support teams in the country's league
item.description: After the coronavirus outbreak in the middle eastern nation, the football season finally restarted last month - with matches in the Syrian Premier League taking place behind closed doors.

item.title: Court hears horrific details about Colt family accused of horrific sexual abuse of inbred children
item.description: Incestuous rape was 'not a secret' in the infamous Colt family with a 17-year-old allegedly sexually assaulted by her uncle told to keep her mouth shut, a judge has been told.

item.title: The interactive IATA coronavirus travel regulations map that reveals restrictions country-by-country
item.description: Simply click on a country and a panel pops up that reveals the latest regulations that apply there. Each country is colour-coded according to how strict its regulations are.

item.title: Horrifying moment a huge crane collapses and crashes onto a busy road in China
item.description: Footage captures the terrifying moment the machine fell apart in Wuhan today. Two people were injured and rushed to hospital after the collapsed machine slammed into two cars parked by the road.

item.title: Hollyoaks responds to Rachel Adedeji's accusations of 'behind the scenes' racism
item.description: Hollyoaks has released a statement after Rachel Adedeji accused the show of racism behind the scenes and slammed its response to the Black Lives Matter movement.

item.title: John Boyega thanks supporters for 'love' after his BLM protest speech
item.description: Taking to Instagram, the actor, 28, shared several photos of himself visiting schools in Southwark, London and said it's important to 'maintain momentum'.

item.title: Police issue CCTV footage of men hurling punches and throwing victims to the ground
item.description: The dramatic clip captures the moment a fight erupted inside Shooters Sports Bar in Birmingham on December 7 last year, leaving one drinker with a broken jaw.

item.title: Met police chief Hogan-Howe who oversaw bungled VIP paedophile ring probe gets Cabinet Office job
item.description: Bernard Hogan-Howe, who was commissioner of the London force between 2011 and 2017, has been appointed to a Cabinet Office committee to give advice on Brexit and the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Mother says counselling helped her cope with 'dark thoughts' while husband battled coronavirus
item.description: Lisa Banks, whose husband Steve, from Essex, was given one per cent chance of survival, told GMB it was important that she could speak about her feelings without 'burdening' her family.

item.title: Princess Anne thanks carers for 'everything they do' during the pandemic
item.description: Princess Anne has marked National Carers week by paying tribute to employees on the frontline in a video message shared to the Royal Family Instagram account.

item.title: Moment terrified Amazon delivery driver leaps on to a car bonnet to escape a tiny CHIHUAHUA
item.description: The Amazon delivery driver leapt onto the bonnet of a customer's white Ford Fiesta after being barked at by a chihuahua when he walked down a driveway in Wakefield, West Yorkshire.

item.title: Roll up, roll up! Clever squirrel walks a tightrope to get his paws on a peanut
item.description: Rocky the clever squirrel channelled his inner circus performer when he walked across a fishing line strung up in Quispamsis, New Brunswick, Canada, to get his paws on a dangling peanut.

item.title: Having a ruff time! Adorable moment puppy flails around as it struggles to climb on to a sofa
item.description: One-year-old Arko the Keeshond clings to a sofa in Lochristi, Belgium, as he tries to pull himself up. Owner Evelien Neyt, 24, filmed the one-year-old puppy struggling to make the climb.

item.title: Marks covering a shark off Hawaii are signs of a fight between the predatory fish and a giant squid
item.description: Researchers from Florida International University studied pictures of the shark taken off Hawaii's Kona coast after they were shared by photographer Deron Verbeck.

item.title: More than half of Cabinet 'support reducing two metre social distancing rule'
item.description: Boris Johnson is pushing for the restriction to be reduced after he was warned more than three million jobs could be lost in the hospitality sector if firms do not reopen.

item.title: Daniel Radcliffe responds to JK Rowling's transphobic Twitter rant: 'Transgender women are women'
item.description: Daniel Radcliffe, 30, who starred as the titular character in the Harry Potter franchise, has called out JK Rowling in a statement released via The Trevor Project on Monday.

item.title: Russian influencer, 35, announces she is pregnant with her 20-year-old stepson's child
item.description: Marina Balmasheva, 35, who hails from the western Russian region of Krasnodar Krai, shared an Instagram video of her sharing the happy news with boyfriend Vladimir yesterday.

item.title: How to make your own Lola's cupcakes: Bakery chain reveal the recipe
item.description: British bakery chain Lola's Cupcakes, which has been closed during the pandemic, has shared the recipe for its Red Velvet cupcakes, for those who are craving the popular sweet treat.

item.title: Elegance coach reveals how to get a man 'begging for your attention'
item.description: London-based Anna Bey, 34, who goes by the moniker 'JetSetBabe' online, divulged the top tips in her latest YouTube clip - suggesting ladies should 'play hard to get' and dress with femininity.

item.title: Pubs need to know TODAY if 27,000 beer gardens can open by June 22 to give landlords enough time
item.description: Brewers across the country need at least three weeks to deliver draught beer, and industry leaders say they need that long to train staff on how to maintain proper social distancing rules.

item.title: Prince Philip to celebrate his 99th birthday with 'low key' video calls and 'a quiet glow of pride'
item.description: The Duke of Edinburgh will celebrate his birthday with video calls to the rest of the royal family as he enjoys low key celebrations with the Queen amid the pandemic this year.

item.title: Man has phone charger removed from his bladder after inserting it into his penis
item.description: A doctor at the hospital in Assam, India said the man had a habit of inserting objects in his penis, which is known as 'urethral sounding', but that he repeatedly told him he had swallowed earphones.

item.title: Boris Johnson is considering slashing prices of new EVs by £6,000
item.description: It could mean that the price of the British-build Nissan Leaf EV falls from £26,845 to just £20,845 and would see a new VW ID.3 zero-emission hatchback cost around the same as a petrol Golf.

item.title: Call in the professionals! Social media users share VERY amusing design fails
item.description: Diply rounded up a selection of the best design fails that people from around the world have shared on social media - including posters for becoming a 'new mum' stuck above the urinals.

item.title: Mother-of-two transforms her twins' nursery using a permanent marker and a projector
item.description: Interior designer Wioleta Kelly, from Tournafulla in Co Limerick, shared the amazing before and after shots of her twins' nursery to the Facebook group Mrs Hinch Made Me Do it.

item.title: These are the six worst habits people are forming while working from home
item.description: Over the past few months, more Australians working from home has led to the formation of poor habits which have negatively impacted work productivity.

item.title: The helpful LinkedIn tactics to get employers to come to you
item.description: An Australian careers expert has revealed how to attract employers and make job opportunities come to you by using primary and secondary keywords on your LinkedIn profile.

item.title: Chicago experiences its most violent day in 60 YEARS as 18 people are gunned down in 1 day
item.description: The University of Chicago Crime Lab said that the 18 people killed on May 31, while the city experienced looting and George Floyd protests, was the most violent day in the city since 1961.

item.title: PAUL THOMAS on... the UK's quarantine plan
item.description: 'Penge Golf Club is too broad a location for your 14 days in quarantine'

item.title: Why dusting with a dry cloth is damaging your furniture and potentially your health
item.description: Dusting furniture with a dry cloth is a lot like washing your skin with sandpaper, cleaning experts have warned.

item.title: Part of China's Great Wall was built to control nomadic people, study says
item.description: 'Genghis Khan's Wall' that was thought to be intended to defend against large invading armies was actually built to control the movements of nomadic populations.

item.title: How the Romans changed our culture is recorded in latest Royal Mail collection
item.description: Royal Mail has launched a collection of eight new picture stamps to celebrate the the Romans in Britain, including famous landmarks such as Hadrian's Wall and Dover Lighthouse.

item.title: Bill Barr says Donald Trump WAS rushed to the bunker at height of protests outside the White House
item.description: Attorney General Bill Barr said the Secret Service 'recommended' that President Trump go down in the bunker' beneath the White House - despite Trump's claim he was performing an 'inspection.'

item.title: Author GILES ANDREAE shares his story of sadness and hope
item.description: GILES ANDREAE: Never have I lost control of myself quite so violently as when I was told that I had cancer for the second time. I was 51 but I had had cancer before, at the age of 22.

item.title: Mum shares how she transformed the space under the stairs into a cubby for her daughter's birthday
item.description: An Australian mum has shared how she and her husband transformed the space under the stairs to make an adorable cubby house for their three-year-old daughter.
